Author: Strob#3417
Content: IT's just like this: komodo_cli -ac_name=BEER z_importkey "$NN_ZKEY" "yes" $height

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Oh, and importing z_key will trigger a rescan from the designated height?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content:
`The part I want to use from Decker's script is a bit beyond me at the moment`
```Send funds to self (consolidating as 1 UTXO) in an raddy and note the block height
create a random z address
store zaddy key
store raddy key
create a new wallet.dat
import raddy privkey without scanning
import the above zaddy key and scan from above block height```
it creates an unused z addy but the z function has more utility so it's used

Author: CrisF#3405
Content: Thanks @ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉! :3040_kingpeepo:

Author: Strob#3417
Content: But can it be like z_merge that also works with Raddy?

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: yes, because since you import the r key 1st the recan will scan for all of your addys in the wallet (which in this case would be 1 raddy and 1 zaddy)

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: z_merge itself, though, wouldn't be any different than a normal send

Author: ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉#7004
Content: the only reason for the z bits is because `z_importkey` has functionality that other commands do not, there's no actual z sending needed
